author: Bruce Pascoe
title: Milestone signifies progress Oumar Ballo, Pelle Larsson making with Arizona Wildcats
text:
Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Bruce Pascoe Once Pelle Larsson picked up his phone after playing Thursday night, the secret was out.
‚ÄúMy mom texted me right after the game, so she made me aware of it,‚Äù Larsson said.
Frida Larsson told her son he needed only seven points to become a 1,000-point scorer in college, which Pelle became during No. 10-ranked Arizona‚Äôs 92-73 win over Utah on Saturday night.
Larsson
A similar scenario was only slightly less obvious to UA center Oumar Ballo, who needed 17 entering Saturday‚Äôs game to reach 1,000. He said he was told in the second half that he was only four points away when Larsson hit the mark with 12:28 left.
Ballo‚Äôs teammates knew it, too. In fact, sophomore Kylan Boswell, who spent the weekend dishing eye-opening assists to Keshad Johnson (a 15-foot no-look bullet against Utah) and Larsson (a 70-foot, double-bounce spiral against Colorado), maybe pushed his luck trying to make it happen.
People are also reading‚Ä¶ New video posted of a jaguar in Southern Arizona Tucson's beloved Roadhouse Cinemas is expanding in a big way 4-mile stretch of I-10 in Tucson to get $171M makeover Viral video of car-top coyote in Tucson racks up 10 million views Video shows new jaguar in Arizona, experts confirm 23 Tucson restaurants that closed their doors in 2023 Off the Vine Arizona Wine Festival is moving to a new spot in Tucson 10 new restaurants and cafes expected to open in Tucson in 2024 Colder Tucson temps coming, along with a chance of snow 80 fun events happening in Tucson this January 2024 üé™üéº New details announced on U of A hiring and pay freezes Tucson asks self-driving truck firm to return $110K in incentive money New storm system to bring cold, wind to Tucson 5 indoor pickleball venues are planned for the Tucson area 23 local restaurants that closed their doors this year üò• With Ballo sitting on 998 for his career entering the final six minutes Saturday, when UA led Utah 77-64, Boswell tried to hit him on the run but threw it too far for a turnover.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt realize he was trying to get O his thousandth point,‚Äù UA coach Tommy Lloyd said. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt like it because it was five-something minutes to go, and (it was) `Let‚Äôs run a little clock, unless we have something easy.‚Äô ‚Äù
So it was Caleb Love, instead, who hit Ballo with an assist less than two minutes later, and nobody, as it turned out, may have been happier to see it than Lloyd.
Ballo
Lloyd noted with a smile after the game that he wasn‚Äôt a ‚Äúmilestone guy‚Äù but spoke to the significance of Ballo‚Äôs achievement, having worked for two years with the Malian big man as a project at Gonzaga ‚Äî and watching him bloom into an all-conference player last season.
Ballo sat out an academic redshirt season in 2019-20 at Gonzaga and then remained behind standout big man Drew Timme and eventually then-freshman Ben Gregg in 2020-21, scoring only 60 points as a redshirt freshman that season.
Then Ballo followed Lloyd to Arizona before the 2021-22 season and has scored 940 points since.
‚ÄúHe was obviously going through some tough times,‚Äù Lloyd said. ‚ÄúHe and I were together, and for him to be able to flip it like this ‚Äî I don‚Äôt think anybody three years ago would have said Oumar Ballo would score 1,000 points.
‚ÄúYou know, it ain‚Äôt easy to score 1,000 points for your career in college and he‚Äôs going to do it in (essentially) three years. So it‚Äôs pretty special. I‚Äôm really really, really proud of him. He‚Äôs a great guy and he‚Äôs a force.‚Äù
Ballo noted simply that he didn‚Äôt play much at Gonzaga ‚Äî just 151 minutes over 24 games ‚Äî and expressed thanks for his opportunities since then at Arizona.
‚ÄúBeen a long and great three years and I‚Äôm grateful for it,‚Äù Ballo said.
Utah guard Rollie Worster gets a handful of Arizona center Oumar Ballo trying to defend his run to the bucket in the first half Saturday. Ballo hit the 1,000-point mark for his career in the second half.
Kelly Presnell, Arizona Daily Star Larsson also arrived at Arizona to join Lloyd after a year elsewhere in 2020-21, but his arrival came under different circumstances. Larsson actually started for Utah during the final 18 games of the 2020-21 season, collecting 204 points and playing much of the time at point guard.
So when Utah fired coach Larry Krystkowiak after the Utes went 12-13 during that COVID-limited season, the 6-5 Swede was a popular transfer portal entrant. Stadium ranked him the No. 51 rated transfer that spring, even though Utah‚Äôs rough season may have reduced his profile.
But less than a month after Arizona hired Lloyd, Larsson committed to the Wildcats.
‚ÄúYou know, I thought about it a couple days ago, and you almost get emotional,‚Äù Lloyd said. ‚ÄúPelle took a chance on me. He did. I hadn‚Äôt won a game. Hadn‚Äôt coached a game. He was getting recruited by Kansas and us, and it was a battle. But he put faith in us. He came here and we‚Äôre lucky. Arizona is lucky and I‚Äôm lucky.‚Äù
Upon arriving in Arizona during the summer of 2021, Larsson said he wanted to stay in the Pac-12 because it featured more European-style finesse and that he realized what Lloyd was bringing over from Gonzaga and wanted to build in Tucson.
‚ÄúJust looking at the rosters and the new coaches, it just was a great fit for me,‚Äù Larsson said then.
Some 784 points later, Larsson coincidentally surpassed the 1,000-point mark against his old team, though he didn‚Äôt make a big deal of it.
Larsson said hitting the milestone against the Utes was ‚Äúkind of full circle, if you want to write that,‚Äù but noted that center Branden Carlson is the only Utah player left from that 2020-21 season. Then he kept his focus mostly ahead: UA has an open week before playing at Washington State on Saturday.
‚ÄúIt goes by quick,‚Äù Larsson said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a lot of fun and you just hope you don‚Äôt really pay attention to the kind of stuff that just happened. I‚Äôm happy for O and, yeah, next game is Saturday.‚Äù
Arizona Men's Basketball Press Conference | Tommy Lloyd | Sunday, Dec. 31, 2023 | After loss at Stanford (Arizona Wildcats YouTube)
Contact sports reporter Bruce Pascoe at bpascoe@tucson.com . On X(Twitter): @brucepascoe
Up next Who: No. 10 Arizona (12-3, 3-1) at Washington State (10-5, 1-3)
When: 4 p.m. Saturday
Where: Beasley Coliseum; Pullman, Wash.
TV: Pac-12 Networks
Radio: 1290-AM, 107.5-FM

ARIZONA (12-3)
Johnson 9-11 0-0 20, Ballo 8-12 1-3 17, Boswell 3-7 2-2 11, Larsson 5-9 1-2 13, Love 9-15 2-2 23, Bradley 2-2 0-0 4, Lewis 0-0 0-0 0, Krivas 1-5 0-0 2, Borovicanin 1-2 0-0 2, Murauskas 0-0 0-0 0. Totals 38-63 6-9 92.
Halftime ‚ÄîArizona 42-39. 3-Point Goals ‚ÄîUtah 10-35 (Madsen 4-9, Bajema 2-4, Be.Carlson 2-9, Smith 1-2, Br.Carlson 1-5, Teat 0-2, Worster 0-4), Arizona 10-18 (Boswell 3-5, Love 3-8, Johnson 2-2, Larsson 2-2, Borovicanin 0-1). Rebounds ‚ÄîUtah 23 (Be.Carlson 6), Arizona 40 (Ballo 9). Assists ‚ÄîUtah 16 (Worster 5), Arizona 22 (Boswell, Love 6). Total Fouls ‚ÄîUtah 12, Arizona 13. A‚Äî 14,688 (14,644).

Lloyd's 1,000-point guys Arizona has had 53 players score 1,000 points exclusively in a Wildcat uniform, though Azuolas Tubelis is the only one to have hit the mark under Tommy Lloyd.
However, it is the transfer portal era, and Lloyd has now coached six other thousand-point scorers who also scored elsewhere after Pelle Larsson and Oumar Ballo reached the milestone Saturday.
The seven 1,000-point scorers to have played under Lloyd at Arizona:
Caleb Love 1,741

Notes:

Larsson needs 198 points to score 1,000 at Arizona.
Keshad Johnson needs 158 points to score 1,000 for his college career (he scored 658 over four previous seasons at San Diego State and has 184 at Arizona this season).
Kerr Kriisa needs 242 to score 1,000 for his college career (he scored 711 over three seasons at Arizona before transferring to West Virginia)
Bennedict Mathurin scored 953 points over two seasons at Arizona before declaring for the 2022 NBA Draft.

author: Denise Orlean
title: Was koche ich heute? Rezept des Tages (Donnerstag, 12. Juni 2025)
text:
Was koche ich heute? Rezept des Tages
Es wird gekocht: Lecker, gesund und einfach.
Quelle: Toa Heftiba/unsplash
Es ist die qu√§lende Frage, die sich fast t√§glich nach dem Feierabend stellt: Was koche ich heute? Pasta, Pizza, Auflauf oder doch lieber die ganz bodenst√§ndige Brotzeit? M√∂glichkeiten gibt es zur Gen√ºge, oft ist es eher die schiere Masse an Gerichten, die so manche m√ºden Arbeitnehmenden zur Verzweiflung treibt.
Was koche ich heute? Rezept des Tages am Donnerstag, 12. Juni
Um Ihnen die Last der Entscheidung abzunehmen, finden Sie anbei unser t√§gliches Rezept zum Nachkochen ‚Äì mal au√üergew√∂hnlich, mal simpel. Hauptsache lecker.
Unser Rezept des Tages passt nicht in Ihren heutigen Speiseplan? Weiter unten im Artikel finden Sie viele andere Ideen zum Nachkochen, ob schnell und einfach, gesund oder besonders beliebt bei Kindern.
Was koche ich heute schnell, einfach und gesund?
Schnell und einfach soll es gehen, da sind sich viele Menschen vor allem unter der stressigen Arbeitswoche einig. Diese schnellen Rezepte bieten eine ideale L√∂sung f√ºr alle, die wenig Zeit haben, aber dennoch etwas Leckeres und Nahrhaftes auf den Tisch bringen m√∂chten. Von leichten Salaten bis hin zu herzhaften Pfannengerichten ‚Äì hier sind einige Ideen f√ºr Mahlzeiten, die im Handumdrehen fertig sind:
Tomatensuppe
- Zwiebel und Knoblauch schneiden und mit √ñl anbraten.
- Tomaten w√ºrfeln, mit in den Topf geben und alles k√∂cheln lassen.
- Tomatenmark, Wasser und Gem√ºsebr√ºhe einr√ºhren, mit Salz, Pfeffer und einer Prise Zucker w√ºrzen.
- Suppe mit dem P√ºrierstab fein mixen. Anschlie√üend mit Cr√®me fra√Æche und Basilikum verfeinern.
R√ºhrei mit Spinat und Tomaten
- Eier verquirlen und in einer Pfanne mit etwas √ñl anbraten.
- Spinat (frisch oder tiefgek√ºhlt) und gew√ºrfelte Tomaten hinzuf√ºgen.
- Mit Salz, Pfeffer und etwas Muskatnuss abschmecken.
Wraps mit H√§hnchen und Gem√ºse
- H√§hnchenbrust in Streifen schneiden und in einer Pfanne anbraten.
- Wraps kurz in der Pfanne oder Mikrowelle erw√§rmen.
- Mit Salat, Tomaten, Gurken, Avocado und dem gebratenen H√§hnchen f√ºllen.
- Nach Belieben mit Joghurt oder einer leichten So√üe betr√§ufeln.
Tomaten-Mozzarella-Salat
- Tomaten und Mozzarella in Scheiben schneiden.
- Auf einem Teller anrichten und mit Basilikumbl√§ttern garnieren.
- Mit Oliven√∂l, Balsamico, Salz und Pfeffer abschmecken.
Nudeln mit Pesto
- Nudeln kochen.
- In einer Sch√ºssel mit fertigem Pesto (Basilikum, Tomate oder nach Wahl) vermischen.
- Optional mit Parmesan und Pinienkernen garnieren.
Avocado-Toast
- Brot toasten.
- Avocado zerdr√ºcken und auf das Brot streichen.
- Mit Salz, Pfeffer, Chiliflocken und einem Spritzer Zitronensaft abschmecken. Optional mit Spiegelei oder Tomatenscheiben belegen.
Gebratener Reis mit Ei
- Gekochten Reis (idealerweise vom Vortag) in einer Pfanne anbraten.
- Gem√ºse (z. B. Erbsen, Karotten) und Sojaso√üe hinzuf√ºgen.
- Ein Ei in die Pfanne schlagen und unter den Reis mischen.
- Mit Fr√ºhlingszwiebeln garnieren.
Kindergerichte: Was koche ich heute f√ºr meine Kinder?
Sitzt der Nachwuchs mit am Esstisch, kann es mit der richtigen Auswahl des Men√ºs schon mal schwer werden. Bei vielen Kindern sorgt Gem√ºse auf dem Teller nur f√ºr verhaltene Begeisterung, mit den richtigen Rezepten lassen sich Vitamine und wichtige N√§hrstoffe aber gekonnt untermischen. Diese Rezepte sind f√ºr kleine ‚ÄûPicky Eater‚Äú geeignet und sorgen f√ºr Abwechslung auf dem Teller:
Spaghetti mit Tomatensauce
Ein Klassiker, den fast alle Kinder lieben. Mit frischen Tomaten, etwas Gem√ºse versteckt in der So√üe und Vollkornnudeln wird es zu einer ausgewogenen Mahlzeit.
Hausgemachte Chicken-Nuggets
Kinder m√∂gen die knusprige Textur und den milden Geschmack. Selbstgemacht sind sie eine ges√ºndere Alternative zu den gekauften Varianten, besonders wenn sie im Ofen gebacken werden.
Minipizzen
Kinder k√∂nnen beim Belegen helfen, was das Essen noch spannender macht. Mit Vollkornteig und viel Gem√ºse als Belag wird die Pizza zu einer nahrhaften Mahlzeit.
Gem√ºsepfannkuchen
Pfannkuchen sind bei Kindern beliebt, und mit geriebenem Gem√ºse wie Karotten oder Zucchini gemischt, werden sie nicht nur bunt, sondern auch gesund.
Mac and Cheese mit Blumenkohl
Mac and Cheese ist ein Kinderfavorit, und durch die Zugabe von p√ºriertem Blumenkohl wird die So√üe cremig und n√§hrstoffreicher, ohne den Geschmack zu ver√§ndern.
Gef√ºllte Paprika
Die bunten, kleinen Paprikaschoten sind kinderfreundlich und k√∂nnen mit einer Mischung aus Reis, Gem√ºse und K√§se gef√ºllt werden. Lecker und ein optischer Hingucker.
Was tun, wenn man nicht gerne kocht?
F√ºr die einen ist es ein Hobby, f√ºr die anderen eine √§rgerliche, t√§gliche Routine: Kochen bereitet nicht jedem Freude, braucht aber dennoch Zeit und M√ºhe. Wer sich dennoch lecker und gesund ern√§hren will, kann auf ein paar Tipps zur√ºckgreifen, um den Aufwand zu minimieren.
- Einfache Rezepte ausw√§hlen
W√§hlen Sie Rezepte mit wenigen Zutaten und einfachen Zubereitungsschritten. Gerichte wie Salate, Sandwiches oder Pasta mit einer schnellen So√üe lassen sich ohne gro√üen Aufwand zubereiten.
- Meal Prep nutzen
Planen Sie die Mahlzeiten f√ºr die Woche im Voraus und bereiten Sie gr√∂√üere Mengen vor. So m√ºssen Sie nur einmal kochen und haben f√ºr mehrere Tage etwas zu essen.
- K√ºchenhelfer einsetzen
Ger√§te wie Slow Cooker, Multikocher oder Mikrowelle k√∂nnen viel Arbeit abnehmen. Sie werfen einfach die Zutaten hinein und lassen das Ger√§t den Rest erledigen.
- Fertiggerichte clever ausw√§hlen
Es gibt mittlerweile viele gesunde Fertiggerichte, die ohne Konservierungsstoffe oder Zusatzstoffe auskommen. Achten Sie auf die Zutatenliste und w√§hlen Sie Mahlzeiten, die viel Gem√ºse und wenig Zucker enthalten.
- Auf einfache Snacks setzen
Obst, N√ºsse, Joghurt und Rohkost mit Dip sind schnelle und gesunde Snacks, die kaum Zubereitung erfordern.
- Hilfe in Anspruch nehmen
Wenn es Ihnen schwerf√§llt, regelm√§√üig zu kochen, k√∂nnen Sie sich auch von Lieferdiensten oder Familienmitgliedern unterst√ºtzen lassen. Manchmal kann es auch helfen, gemeinsam mit anderen zu kochen, um den Spa√ü daran zu entdecken.
- Einfache Kombinationen lernen
Erlernen Sie ein paar Grundrezepte oder einfache Kombinationen, die Sie immer wieder variieren k√∂nnen. Zum Beispiel: Reis mit Gem√ºse und einer Proteinquelle (wie H√ºhnchen oder Tofu) oder eine schnelle Gem√ºsepfanne.
- Tiefk√ºhlkost und Konserven verwenden
Tiefk√ºhlgem√ºse und -obst oder Konserven wie Bohnen und Tomaten sind bereits geschnitten und gewaschen und k√∂nnen direkt verwendet werden. Sie sparen Zeit und bieten dennoch viele N√§hrstoffe.
- Die richtigen Gew√ºrze verwenden
Gute Gew√ºrze k√∂nnen auch einfachen Gerichten viel Geschmack verleihen, ohne dass man lange in der K√ºche stehen muss. Eine kleine Sammlung an Lieblingsgew√ºrzen kann das Kochen erheblich erleichtern.
Foodtrends bei Tiktok: Diese Rezepte sind viral gegangen
Wer bei Foodtrends ganz vorne mit dabei sein m√∂chte, der kommt um die Social-Media-Plattform Tiktok nicht herum. ‚ÄûBaked Feta Pasta‚Äú, ‚ÄûDalgona Iced Coffee‚Äú oder ‚ÄûGreen Goddess‚Äú sind nur einige der Rezepte, die es in dem Netzwerk zu Millionen von Klicks gebracht haben. Eine Auswahl von Tiktok-Foodtrends und wie sie zubereitet werden:
Dalgona-Coffee
Green Goddess
Salmon Rice Bowl
Instant-Ramen
Gurkensalat
Baked Feta Pasta

title: ¬øUn gui√±o a Boca?: el agresivo gesto de Paredes al ser reemplazado por el t√©cnico de la Roma | 442
text:
En el marco de la octava y √∫ltima jornada de la UEFA Europa League , la Roma le gan√≥ 2-0 al Eintracht Frankfurt y avanz√≥ a la siguiente instancia. No obstante, todas las c√°maras apuntaron hacia el agresivo gesto que realiz√≥ Leandro Paredes al ser sustituido: sacudi√≥ los brazos, no vio a su compa√±ero y pate√≥ una botella.
Con el resultado 1-0 a favor gracias a un gol de Angeli√±o, el mediocampista de la Selecci√≥n Argentina debi√≥ abandonar el campo de juego baj√≥ las √≥rdenes del director t√©cnico, Claudio Ranieri.
Al momento de ver reflejado el n√∫mero 16 en el cartel, Paredes cambi√≥ rotundamente su cara y mostr√≥ claros gestos de calentura: r√°pidamente se sac√≥ los guantes y, completamente desolado, sacudi√≥ sus brazos en forma de angustia.
 Incluso, mientras se retiraba del campo de juego en lentitud y en cabizbajo, apenas observ√≥ a su compa√±ero reemplazante Bryan Cristante, quien intent√≥ consolarlo pero no lo logr√≥: Paredes se acerc√≥ al banco de suplentes y pate√≥ con gran furia una botella de agua que estaba en el piso, dejando en claro su gran enojo por salir.
Como era de esperarse, esto aliment√≥ los rumores que lo acercan a Boca Juniors, algo que adem√°s fue reflejado en los mismos usuarios de las redes sociales, quienes anhelan la vuelta de campe√≥n del mundo al club de La Ribera.
Inclusive, el mismo t√©cnico italiano de la Roma se hab√≠a expresado acerca de estos rumores con el Xeneize: " Todos los rumores que escucho sobre Leandro los escucho de ustedes, no de √©l. Ciertamente, si √©l no quiere quedarse, al igual que Hermoso, no detendr√© a nadie‚Äù.
FMZ

author: Danielle Battaglia McClatchy Washington Bureau
title: Congress passed only 31 laws in 2023 | From The Wire | wyomingnews.com
text: WASHINGTON ‚Äî Members of Congress spent the past 12 months ensuring that this session would be one for the history books. It was punctuated with the first removal of a House speaker, the first interim speaker and the first member to be expelled in more than 20 years. There was Republican infighting and almost physical fighting in a hallway, a committee meeting and even on the House floor. But what people won‚Äôt remember about 2023 is the long list of legislation passed through the hallowed halls of Congress. That‚Äôs because it doesn‚Äôt exist. In fact, only 31 pieces of legislation became law since Jan. 1, making this year one of the most ineffective in congressional history. President Joe Biden signed eight of those bills into law just this month. Debt ceiling Among the 16 members of North Carolina‚Äôs congressional delegation, they sponsored 214 pieces of legislation. Only one member succeeded at having his bill become law: Rep. Patrick McHenry, a Republican from Lincoln County. McClatchy looked specifically at bills originated by members. That does not take into account that some of the 214 bills may have been added into one of the 31 that became law, or include bills that passed through only one chamber. It also does not include bills they co-sponsored. On June 3, Biden signed McHenry‚Äôs Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023 into law, narrowly preventing an economic collapse, that would have been caused by the country‚Äôs failure to meet its financial obligations. ‚ÄúThis is the most conservative spending package during my time in Congress,‚Äù McHenry said then in a written statement. ‚ÄúThe Fiscal Responsibility Act is the largest deficit-reduction bill in at least a decade and will fundamentally change the spending trajectory in Washington.‚Äù Crime in Washington, DC Another piece of legislation had to do with Washington‚Äôs plans to revise its criminal code. The city‚Äôs council proposed new rules would lower maximum penalties for most crimes. The constitution gives Congress authority over the city‚Äôs laws, which means that if enough lawmakers oppose the criminal code revisions, Washington wouldn‚Äôt be able to move forward. Sen. Thom Tillis, R-North Carolina, addressed the bill on the Senate floor: ‚ÄúThe far left is so out of touch that they want to reduce penalties for violent crimes in D.C. while residents, federal employees, members of Congress, visiting constituents, and even our visiting diplomats are facing greater risk. I hope President Biden proves his commitment to public safety by working with my colleagues and me on commonsense, bipartisan proposals to keep our communities safe.‚Äù Many members of Congress maintain residences in Washington, while working in the city on behalf of their constituents. Tillis has recently said he no longer feels safe walking home at night from the U.S. Capitol. This year alone, a congresswoman was assaulted in her Washington apartment building, a congressman was carjacked after coming home late from the Capitol and a staffer was stabbed leaving a restaurant. The bill passed through both chambers, and Biden signed it into law. Veterans‚Äô issues Of the 31 bills passed, 11 either helped veterans or commemorated the military in some way. Tillis co-sponsored a bill that helps National Guard members facing financial hardships, keeping them from having their higher income from the National Guard used in bankruptcy proceedings, instead of that of their normal jobs. It ended up in the House version, sponsored by Rep. Steve Cohen, a Democrat from Tennessee, that was signed into law last week. Other bills that passed, and who sponsored them: - Rep. Mike Rogers, a Republican from Alabama, sponsored a bill to fund the military‚Äôs budget in 2024. - Rep. Pete Aguilar, a Democrat from California; aims to ensure the Department of Veterans Affairs makes accessing claims or benefits records easier for users. The department is required to create an online system for veterans or their representatives to request documents. The department must fulfill requests within 120 days. - Sen. Jon Tester, a Democrat from Montana; gave veterans a cost-of-living increase beginning on Dec. 1. The increase was for disability compensation, clothing allowance, dependency and indemnity compensation for spouses and children. - Rep. Mark Takano, a Democrat from California; helped veterans from South Korea who fought alongside the United States in the Vietnam war to receive health care benefits. - Sen. Mike Braun, a Republican from Indiana; strengthened benefits for Vietnam veterans exposed to Agent Orange who then had children born with spina bifida. Under this new law, Veteran Affairs must provide lifetime health care, job training and monetary benefits to the children who have spina bifida whose parents were exposed to Agent Orange during the war. Health care laws The two chambers also tackled issues in health care. One of the first pieces of legislation to pass through Congress ordered the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to declassify information about potential links between the Wuhan Institute of Virology in China and the origin of COVID-19. Sen. Josh Hawley, a Republican from Missouri, sponsored the bill and it passed both chambers unanimously. Less universally accepted was Arizona Republican Rep. Paul Gosar‚Äôs bill to end the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency. Reps. Foxx, Murphy and Edwards and Sens. Tillis and Budd co-sponsored bills in their chambers. Another bill, signed last week and co-sponsored by Foushee, Jackson and Ross, looks at best practices involving Xylazine, a medication used by veterinarians that when mixed with fentanyl has made the drug Narcan ineffective in reversing some drug overdoses. Under the new law, the National Institute of Standards and Technology must research Xylazine, create rapid detection tests for the drug and create partnerships with organizations that might come into contact with street drugs. What‚Äôs next? Congress ended the year without tackling some major issues like funding Israel and Ukraine or enhancing the nation‚Äôs border security. It‚Äôs becoming routine news, but Congress also returns in January facing down another potential government shutdown if lawmakers can‚Äôt agree on how to fund the government. Meanwhile, the 2024 election season is underway with a series of upcoming primaries, meaning everything Congress does will be held to higher scrutiny. Let the news come to you Get any of our free email newsletters ‚Äî news headlines, sports, arts & entertainment, state legislature, CFD news, and more. [Explore newsletters](/newsletters/)

author: GlobeNewswire
title: Trust Stamp Partners With Scurid to Deliver AI-Powered In-Field Authentication
text: Trust Stamp Partners With Scurid to Deliver AI-Powered In-Field Authentication Trust Stamp‚Äôs Privacy-first AI-powered biometric technology, combined with Scurid‚Äôs platform ensures a secure and streamlined process, making the hassle of traditional authentication methods a thing of the past and it paves the way for a fluid, intuitive and seamless authentication between humans and machines, while addressing crucial security and privacy concerns [Trust Stamp](https://truststamp.ai/), the Privacy-First Identity CompanyTM, providing [ AI-powered](https://aithority.com/tag/AI-powered/) trust and identity services, has entered a partnership with Scurid, a global pioneer in delivering cutting-edge solutions for Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) device identity and access management (IAM) platform, that enhances device identities through the incorporation of interoperability and [data management](https://aithority.com/tag/data-management/) functionalities. Scurid‚Äôs user-friendly platform, enables seamless connectivity among IoT edge devices,IoT platforms, databases, and other applications, allowing clients to implement secure autonomous IoT systems swiftly in their applications, and with a deployment base exceeding 1000 devices, Scurid has earned trust in production environments, providing their customers the ability to bring their innovations to market swiftly and securely. Read More about AiThority Interview: [AiThority Interview with Jim Kaskade, Chief Executive Officer at Conversica](https://aithority.com/botsintelligent-assistants/aithority-interview-with-jim-kaskade-chief-executive-officer-at-conversica/) In a strategic collaboration aimed at enhancing the smooth and secure interaction between humans and machines, Scurid has joined forces with Trust Stamp, to leverage the benefits of biometrics as it opens an avenue to elevate the usability and security of IoT devices. This partnership is poised to play a crucial role in fortifying a diverse array of emerging IoT and edge devices, effectively addressing security challenges, and establishing seamless authentication and authorization, fostering a more integrated connection between humans and machines However, biometric data storage and transmission, particularly for IoT and edge devices, pose security challenges. Encryption, while common, is not foolproof, leading to potential breaches. Moreover, in biometric systems with extensive databases, the search process for a match can be computationally intensive and time-consuming, and encryption adds complexity, further slowing down system response time and accuracy. By utilizing biometric tokenization, like that of Trust Stamp‚Äôs IT2, it addresses these issues, providing performance and security. By transforming facial biometrics into a tokenized, irreversible form, the risk of unauthorized access or use of exfiltrated biometric data is significantly reduced. Scurid, in synergy with Trust Stamp‚Äôs biometric verification, has the potential to revolutionize secure identification and authorization across diverse IoT deployments such as fleet management, smart manufacturing, smart cities, and smart warehouses. This seamless integration forms a scalable, comprehensive solution, eliminating the complexities of traditional authentication and fostering a fluid, intuitive interaction between humans and machines. Scurid‚Äôs platform is not just secure but also highly adaptable, ensuring ease of integration with any existing platform without vendor lock-in. Its built-in capabilities replace the need for multiple toolchains, offering a well-rounded, self-sufficient solution. The decentralized core of Scurid‚Äôs device identity significantly reduces the risk and impact of security breaches, making it a cost-effective, reliable choice for dynamic device identity implementation. This approach paves the way for a new era in security dynamics, where users can grant access with unprecedented precision, reshaping the interaction between users and machines in the digital world. AiThority Interview Insights: [AiThority Interview with Ramsey Masri, Chief Executive Officer at Ceres Imaging](https://aithority.com/technology/aithority-interview-with-ramsey-masri-chief-executive-officer-at-ceres-imaging/) This collaborative project between Trust Stamp and Scurid not only addresses security challenges in IoT and edge devices but also exemplifies the multifaceted uses of Trust Stamp‚Äôs IT2 technology, showcasing its adaptability and efficacy in diverse sectors such as finance, healthcare, and government, where precise and secure identification is essential for fostering trust and efficiency. AiThority Interview Insights : [AiThority Interview with Itamar Kandel, Chief Executive Officer at Vista.ai](https://aithority.com/medical-apps/healthcare-management/aithority-interview-with-itamar-kandel-chief-executive-officer-at-vista-ai/) [To share your insights with us, please write to [sghosh@martechseries.com](mailto:sghosh@martechseries.com)]

author: Al-Monitor Independent
title: Israel bombs Gaza as oldest woman held hostage confirmed dead
text:
Israeli forces on Thursday battled Hamas in Gaza where air strikes and urban combat rocked the southern city of Khan Yunis, near where many hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians have sought refuge.
UN World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus called for "urgent steps to alleviate the grave peril" facing besieged Gaza's people, including "terrible injuries, acute hunger and... severe risk of disease".
In Jerusalem, families of hostages still held by Hamas in Gaza again rallied for their release, and a kibbutz announced that a 70-year-old US-Israeli thought to be the oldest woman held captive had died in the October 7 attacks.
US President Joe Biden said he was "devastated" by the news Judith Weinstein Haggai was dead, and pledged that Washington will "not stop working" with its ally Israel to bring the remaining hostages home.
The war, which started with Hamas's October 7 attack on Israel, has left much of northern Gaza in ruins while the battlefront has shifted ever further to the south of the besieged territory.
The Israeli army said it had deployed an additional brigade to Khan Yunis, hometown of Hamas's Gaza leader Yahya Sinwar, where AFP correspondents reported sustained air and artillery strikes.
The Palestinian Red Crescent society reported that shelling had killed at least 10 people near the city's Al-Amal hospital, an area where it said about 14,000 people are sheltering.
Later Thursday, Hamas-run Gaza's health ministry said 20 people were killed, most of them women and children, and dozens wounded in shelling of the Shaboura camp in the southern city of Rafah.
Israel has vowed to destroy Hamas in retaliation for the October 7 attack which left about 1,140 people dead, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally based on Israeli figures.
Hamas on October 7 also took 250 hostages, more than half of whom remain captive -- a source of intense anxiety for their families who protested in Jerusalem with the demand to "bring them home".
Israel's relentless aerial bombardment and ground invasion have killed at least 21,320 people, mostly women and children, according to Hamas-run Gaza's health ministry.
Ashraf al-Qudra, spokesman for the ministry, on Thursday reported an additional 200 deaths, "including entire families", over the past 24 hours in strikes.
The Israeli army says 167 of its soldiers have been killed inside Gaza in its fight against Hamas which Israel, the United States and European Union consider a "terrorist" group.
In total, the army said, more than 500 soldiers had been killed since October 7, including in the Hamas attack and the battle to retake control of southern Israel, inside Gaza, and in cross-border hostilities with Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.
- Quadruplets born in war -
More than 80 percent of Gaza's 2.4 million people have been driven from their homes, the UN says, and many now live in cramped shelters or makeshift tents in the far south, around the city of Rafah near Egypt.
In the central al-Maghazi refugee camp, which was targeted on Sunday by a strike that killed at least 70 people, resident Waleed Mohammed Aeid voiced his pain and frustration.
"They told us to go to Rafah, but we don't want to," he said. "Why? To go live in the streets there?
"All the neighbourhood here was evacuated. They bombed the school, but we didn't leave because we don't have anywhere else to go."
An Israeli siege imposed after October 7, following years of crippling blockade, has deprived Gazans of food, water, fuel and medicine.
The severe shortages have been only sporadically eased by humanitarian aid convoys entering primarily via Egypt.
Israel said Thursday it had given preliminary approval to the Mediterranean island nation of Cyprus for a "maritime lifeline" to ship aid to Gaza.
"There's a basic authorisation to use this route, but there are still some logistical problems that are waiting to be solved," said Israeli foreign ministry spokesman Lior Haiat.
One of the many Palestinians displaced, 28-year-old Iman al-Masry, recently gave birth to quadruplets in southern Gaza after fleeing her home in the devastated north.
The arduous journey "affected my pregnancy", she said, recounting that she gave birth by C-section on December 18 to two girls and two boys, one of whom was too fragile to leave hospital.
"They are very slim," she said, speaking in a schoolroom turned shelter in Deir al-Balah. "It's cold and windy and there's no bathtub... I just use wipes."
- Mideast tensions flare -
Violence has also flared across the Israel-occupied West Bank, with at least 314 Palestinians killed by Israeli forces or settlers since October 7, according to the territory's health ministry.
Israeli forces overnight raided money exchange shops across the West Bank which the military said had provided funds for armed groups.
In Ramallah, seat of the Palestinian Authority, one man was killed by the troops, according to the health ministry, and another was later shot near Bethlehem.
A UN report said the human rights situation in the West Bank was rapidly deteriorating and urged Israel to "end unlawful killings" against the Palestinian population.
The bloodiest ever Gaza war has also sharply heightened tensions between Israel and its long-time arch foe Iran, which supports armed groups across the Middle East.
Iran blamed Israel for a missile strike in Syria on Monday that killed the senior Iranian military commander Razi Moussavi, whose mass funeral took place in Tehran on Thursday.
The crowd chanted "Death to Israel" and "Death to America" after supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei led a prayer over the body of Moussavi, a top commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' foreign operations arms the Quds Force.
Tehran has vowed to avenge the death of the most senior Guards general killed since the US assassination of Quds Force chief Qasem Soleimani in 2020.
Israel has traded heavy cross-border fire with Iran-backed Hezbollah in Lebanon since the Gaza war erupted, and warned it will step up military action unless Hezbollah militants withdraw further from the border.
Hezbollah accused Israel of hacking into CCTV camera systems installed outside homes and shops in southern Lebanon and urged residents there to take the devices offline.
Another Iran ally, Yemen's Huthi rebel group, has launched repeated drone and missile attacks at Israel, which have been intercepted. It has also targeted ships in the Red Sea, disrupting international trade.

author: Beatriz P√©rez
title: El Cl√≠nic remet la meitat de casos de c√†ncer sense opcions
text:
Aven√ßos m√®dics
El Cl√≠nic remet la meitat de casos de c√†ncer sense opcions
El centre es consolida com a referent de ter√†pies CAR-T p√∫bliques despr√©s de tractar m√©s de 500 pacients en els √∫ltims vuit anys.
La immunoter√†pia CAR-7 modifica gen√®ticament els limf√≤cits T del pacient
Un total de 502 pacients s‚Äôhan tractat des del 2017 amb alguna immunoter√†pia CAR-T pr√≤pia de l‚ÄôHospital Cl√≠nic de Barcelona per tractar la leuc√®mia aguda limfobl√†stica, el mieloma m√∫ltiple o el limfoma, que s√≥n tres tipus de c√†ncers hematol√≤gics. Tots aquests pacients estaven en una fase molt avan√ßada de la seva malaltia i no els quedaven ja m√©s opcions terap√®utiques. M√©s de la meitat d‚Äôells han vist com el seu c√†ncer remetia de manera completa. Arreu del m√≥n s‚Äôhan tractat uns 38.000 pacients amb alguna ter√†pia CAR-T comercial. Dels 502 pacients tractats amb alguna CAR-T p√∫blica del C√≠nic (hospital que lidera la producci√≥ i tractament estatals), un 70% procedien d‚Äôaltres hospitals d‚ÄôEspanya.
El Cl√≠nic t√© quatre CAR-T acad√®mics (√©s a dir, que han sigut produ√Øts pel mateix hospital, a difer√®ncia dels comercials, que s√≥n els fabricats per la ind√∫stria farmac√®utica), dos d‚Äôaquests ja aprovats i finan√ßats per l‚ÄôAg√®ncia Espanyola de Medicaments i Productes Sanitaris (AEMPS). "Aquest √©s un model √∫nic al m√≥n: podem produir CAR-T, s√≥n efica√ßos i el sistema de salut els finan√ßa", va assenyalar ahir √Ålvaro Urbano-Ispizua, coordinador del Programa CAR-T del Cl√≠nic-Idibaps i cap del grup Trasplantaments de Progenitors Hematopo√®tics de l‚ÄôIdibaps. El Cl√≠nic va fer una roda de premsa per presentar aquestes xifres, que considera que s√≥n tota una "fita". L‚Äôaccessibilitat a aquestes ter√†pies encara √©s molt limitada: un 6% als pa√Øsos industrialitzats.
La immunoter√†pia, que actua sobre el sistema immunitari del pacient oncol√≤gic, √©s ara com ara el m√©s revolucionari en el tractament del c√†ncer. Hi ha molts tipus d‚Äôimmunoter√†pia i una d‚Äôaquestes √©s la ter√†pia cel¬∑lular CAR-T. El terme CAR respon a les sigles angleses de receptor d‚Äôantigen quim√®ric. Quan aquesta ter√†pia, com √©s el cas, es porta a terme als limf√≤cits T (unes c√®l¬∑lules del sistema immunitari, a la sang), llavors passa a denominar-se CAR-T. Consisteix a modificar gen√®ticament els limf√≤cits T despr√©s d‚Äôextreure sang al malalt, perqu√® actu√Øn contra el c√†ncer.
Els CAR-T del Cl√≠nic aprovats per l‚ÄôAEMPS com a medicaments de ter√†pia avan√ßada de fabricaci√≥ no industrial s√≥n l‚ÄôARI-0001 (per a la leuc√®mia limfobl√†stica aguda) i l‚ÄôARI-0002h (mieloma m√∫ltiple).
Autoritzaci√≥ a la UE
Not√≠cies relacionadesEl pr√≤xim pas √©s mirar d‚Äôaconseguir tamb√© l‚Äôaprovaci√≥ per part de l‚ÄôAg√®ncia Europea de Medicaments (EMA), que ja ha considerat com a "prioritari" l‚ÄôARI-0001. Per√≤, a m√©s, el Cl√≠nic est√† avan√ßant amb l‚ÄôARI-0003 (una CAR-T dual, que ataca dues dianes diferents) i amb l‚ÄôARI-0007, per a un tipus concret de leuc√®mia limfobl√†stica. Alhora, est√† desenvolupant una CAR-T per a un tipus de c√†ncer de mama (el de HER2), ja que aquestes ter√†pies tamb√© han mostrat la seva efectivitat en tumors s√≤lids i fins i tot en malalties m√©s enll√† del c√†ncer, com el lupus.
El nom d‚ÄôARI √©s en honor a Ariadna Bened√©, una pacient amb leuc√®mia que va arribar al Cl√≠nic el 2016 i que va iniciar un projecte de mecenatge perqu√® l‚Äôhospital pogu√©s desenvolupar aquesta ter√†pia que ja s‚Äôestava fabricant als EUA. Desafortunadament, ella no es va poder beneficiar del tractament i va morir l‚Äôany seg√ºent.

author: Mark61
title: No Internet. Openreach little box on wall has a red LOS light
text:
Get expert support with your Fibre connection.
25 minutes ago
My Internet went down 3 days ago I have done all the usual resets, taking plugs out, taking all wires out and still no luck. I've notice the little open reach box on my wall has a red LOS light on. Tried to contact Talktalk with no luck. They are an absolute joke. Is there a number I can phone
11 minutes ago
Hi Mark,
As fr8ys has said, if you can update your profile we'll be happy to take a look at this for you
Chris
Chris, Community Team
[Our latest Blog](/blog) l [Share your Ideas](/ideas) l [Service Status](/servicestatus) l [Help with your Service](/t5/Help-with-your-TalkTalk-service/ct-p/help) l [Community Stars](/t5/custom/page/page-id/SuperUserHub) l Set your preferences
13 minutes ago
You can Try phoning 0345 172 0088
Opening Hours can be found here - https://community.talktalk.co.uk/t5/Articles/How-to-contact-TalkTalk-Broadband/ta-p/2230529#
Or you can wait until a support staff member responds to your thread in which case can you please details the steps you have tried yourself to rectify the issue, such as turning the ONT box off and turning back on. You will be asked this and more if you phone.
If you wish support staff to look into, for a quicker reply can you please ensure you have your personal information up to date in your profile including your TalkTalk landline phone number so your account can be traced. Link here - https://community.talktalk.co.uk/t5/user/myprofilepage/tab/personal-profile:personal-info
If you are unsure of your phone number, you can find this in My Account or dial 17070 from your landline phone and this will confirm the number for you.
You can also add your account number in the private notes field, which only you and the support staff can view.
Please post back when done.
Thank you
